item.title: Bryan add a quote by Harry Partch
item.description: "I have thrown the petty respectable life with all is comforts behind me after the effort to broaden and beautify it has destituted me and drained my stamina. All right--let me throw it behind without guile, without hoping either for a return to it or for a constant absence. After all, it did not request my efforts. The normal live body hopes for the respect and love of others, and enough of the world to bestow largesse. He hopes and he abandons hope by turn. In the first there is fire to live, but in the second there is greater peace." -- Harry Partch

item.title: Bryan add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "You have to be with other people, he thought. In order to live at all. I mean before they came here I could stand it... But now it has changed. You can't go back, he thought. You can't go from people to nonpeople." - J.R. Isidore" -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Bryan add a quote by Bonnie Jo Campbell
item.description: "I’ve never shot like that in my life. That’s unholy.” Uncle Cal claimed credit for teaching her to shoot, but while Margo had felt his guidance, she had felt just as strongly the guidance of the gun itself. It held her steady, and then sadness perfected her aim." -- Bonnie Jo Campbell

item.title: Bryan add a quote by Arthur Rimbaud
item.description: "My wisdom is as spurned as chaos. What is my nothingness, compared to the amazement that awaits you?" -- Arthur Rimbaud
